org.gephi.ranking.api
Interface Transformer<Target>

public interface Transformer<Target>

Transformers role is to transform nodes/edges numerical attributes to visual signs (e.g. color or sizes). It uses a normalized real number between zero and one to output a meaningful value.

Transformers can be applied to a subset of values using lower/bound filter values.

Default transformers implemented in the RankingPlugin:

  • RENDERABLE_COLOR: Sets node/edge color
  • RENDERABLE_SIZE: Sets node/edge size. For edges, the size is the weight.
  • LABEL_COLOR: Sets label color.
  • LABEL_SIZE: Sets label size. Note this is a multiplier.

    • Author:
    Mathieu Bastian
    See Also:

    Method Detail

    setLowerBound

    void setLowerBound(float lowerBound)
    Sets the lower filter bound. Values lower than this value won't be transformed. By default the bound is set to zero, so no filtering.

    Parameters:
    lowerBound - the lower bound filter value

    setUpperBound

    void setUpperBound(float upperBound)
    Sets the upper filter bound. Values upper than this value won't be transformed. By default the bound is set to one, so no filtering.

    Parameters:
    upperBound - the upper bound filter value

    getLowerBound

    float getLowerBound()
    Returns the lower bound filter value. By default it's set to zero, so filtering is disabled.

    Returns:
    the lower bound filter value

    getUpperBound

    float getUpperBound()
    Returns the upper bound filter value. By default it's set to one, so filtering is disabled.

    Returns:
    the upper bound filter value

    isInBounds

    boolean isInBounds(float value)
    Returns true if value is within the lower and the upper bound. Typically, this is called before transform() to know if a value can be processed. By default, this always returns true, as lower bound is set ot zero and upper bound to one.

    Parameters:
    value - the value to test if in bounds
    Returns:
    true if value superior or equal to lowerBound and value inferior or equal to upperBound, false otherwise

    transform

    java.lang.Object transform(Target target,
                           float normalizedValue)
    Transforms target with normalizedValue between zero and one. The method also returns the transformed value, like the color for instance for a color transformer.

    Parameters:
    target - the object to transform
    normalizedValue - the ranking normalized value
    Returns:
    the transformed value, or null
